events.name: China launches third aircraft carrier, June 2022
events.wd_label: China launches third aircraft carrier, June 2022
events.wd_description: China launched its third aircraft carrier, the "Fujian," the first to be wholly designed and built in the country, marking a significant advancement in its military capabilities.
events.description: China launched its third aircraft carrier, the "Fujian," the first to be wholly designed and built in the country, marking a significant advancement in its military capabilities.

events.name: Launch of the "Fujian" aircraft carrier
events.wd_description: The "Fujian," China's third and most advanced aircraft carrier, was launched at a Shanghai shipyard, featuring a catapult launcher system.
events.description: The "Fujian," China's third and most advanced aircraft carrier, was launched at a Shanghai shipyard, featuring a catapult launcher system.

events.name: Comparison with previous carriers
events.wd_description: The "Fujian" is more technically advanced than China's previous carriers, "Liaoning" and "Shandong," which use a ski-jump-style platform for launching aircraft.
events.description: The "Fujian" is more technically advanced than China's previous carriers, "Liaoning" and "Shandong," which use a ski-jump-style platform for launching aircraft.

events.name: Geopolitical implications
events.wd_description: The launch of the "Fujian" comes amid rising tensions between China and the US, with Chinese defense minister Wei Fenghe warning of potential conflict if Taiwan declares independence.
events.description: The launch of the "Fujian" comes amid rising tensions between China and the US, with Chinese defense minister Wei Fenghe warning of potential conflict if Taiwan declares independence.

events.name: Boris Johnson comments on Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_label: Boris Johnson comments on Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson commented on Russian President Vladimir Putin's slow but visible progress in the Donbas region of Eastern Ukraine, expressing concerns over the high cost to Russia.
events.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson commented on Russian President Vladimir Putin's slow but visible progress in the Donbas region of Eastern Ukraine, expressing concerns over the high cost to Russia.

events.name: Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_description: Johnson noted that Putin continues to make progress in Donbas, despite the high cost to himself and the Russian military.
events.description: Johnson noted that Putin continues to make progress in Donbas, despite the high cost to himself and the Russian military.

events.name: Invasion background
events.wd_description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, launched on February 24, is termed a "special military operation" by Russia, but is considered a war of aggression by Ukraine and the West.
events.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, launched on February 24, is termed a "special military operation" by Russia, but is considered a war of aggression by Ukraine and the West.

events.name: Johnson's perspective on ending the conflict
events.wd_label: Johnson's perspective on ending the conflict
events.wd_description: Johnson stated that the conflict can end only if Putin acknowledges that the denazification of Ukraine has been achieved and withdraws with dignity and honor, although he clarified he does not support the premise that there were Nazis in Ukraine.
events.description: Johnson stated that the conflict can end only if Putin acknowledges that the denazification of Ukraine has been achieved and withdraws with dignity and honor, although he clarified he does not support the premise that there were Nazis in Ukraine.

events.name: Malaysia's chicken export ban to Singapore, June 2022
events.wd_label: Malaysia's chicken export ban to Singapore, June 2022
events.wd_description: Malaysia imposed an embargo on the export of live chickens to Singapore to address local shortages, leading to concerns in Singapore about the impact on poultry supply and prices, as chicken is a staple of the national diet.
events.description: Malaysia imposed an embargo on the export of live chickens to Singapore to address local shortages, leading to concerns in Singapore about the impact on poultry supply and prices, as chicken is a staple of the national diet.

events.name: Malaysian export ban
events.wd_description: The Malaysian Prime Minister announced a ban on the export of live chickens to combat local shortages and control rising prices.
events.description: The Malaysian Prime Minister announced a ban on the export of live chickens to combat local shortages and control rising prices.

events.name: Impact on Singapore's poultry supply
events.wd_description: The ban significantly affects Singapore, which relies on Malaysia for a third of its poultry imports, with concerns about price surges and the adequacy of frozen chicken as a substitute.
events.description: The ban significantly affects Singapore, which relies on Malaysia for a third of its poultry imports, with concerns about price surges and the adequacy of frozen chicken as a substitute.

events.name: Global food shortage context
events.wd_description: The chicken shortage in Singapore adds to the global food shortages experienced in recent months, exacerbating supply chain challenges and rising prices.
events.description: The chicken shortage in Singapore adds to the global food shortages experienced in recent months, exacerbating supply chain challenges and rising prices.

events.name: Automakers investing in battery production
events.wd_description: Automakers are committing billions of dollars to increase battery production, with new plants being built by Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Stellantis, and Samsung.
events.description: Automakers are committing billions of dollars to increase battery production, with new plants being built by Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Stellantis, and Samsung.

events.name: Ford and General Motors
events.wd_description: Ford is building a plant in Kentucky, and General Motors is working with LG to develop a battery factory in Michigan.
events.description: Ford is building a plant in Kentucky, and General Motors is working with LG to develop a battery factory in Michigan.

events.name: Hyundai's investment
events.wd_description: Hyundai announced a $5.5 billion investment in a battery and electric vehicle plant in Georgia.
events.description: Hyundai announced a $5.5 billion investment in a battery and electric vehicle plant in Georgia.

events.name: Stellantis and Samsung's plan
events.wd_description: Stellantis and Samsung unveiled a plan to build a $2.5 billion facility in Indiana.
events.description: Stellantis and Samsung unveiled a plan to build a $2.5 billion facility in Indiana.

events.name: Current reliance on China
events.wd_description: A majority of battery cells are currently made in China, with international supply chain disruptions caused by COVID lockdowns and the war in Ukraine.
events.description: A majority of battery cells are currently made in China, with international supply chain disruptions caused by COVID lockdowns and the war in Ukraine.

events.name: Increasing control over supply chains
events.wd_description: Car companies want more control over their parts supply as EV demand grows, with the federal government also investing in supply chains.
events.description: Car companies want more control over their parts supply as EV demand grows, with the federal government also investing in supply chains.

events.name: Federal investment
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden is investing over $3 billion in the battery supply chain, with companies positioning to secure federal grants.
events.description: President Joe Biden is investing over $3 billion in the battery supply chain, with companies positioning to secure federal grants.

events.name: Transition to EVs
events.wd_description: Automakers need significant upfront investment in new machinery and factories to transition from gasoline-powered vehicles to EVs.
events.description: Automakers need significant upfront investment in new machinery and factories to transition from gasoline-powered vehicles to EVs.

events.name: Challenges in building supply chains
events.wd_description: Building factories is easier than securing access to raw materials like lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are crucial for building the supply chain.
events.description: Building factories is easier than securing access to raw materials like lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are crucial for building the supply chain.

events.name: Timeframe for building mines
events.wd_description: While it might take three to four years to build a factory, getting permits to build new lithium or nickel mines in the U.S. could take closer to 10 years.
events.description: While it might take three to four years to build a factory, getting permits to build new lithium or nickel mines in the U.S. could take closer to 10 years.
